intro: Seseli luteolum, commonly known as yellow seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a bluish-green hue. Seseli luteolum is native to parts of Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in open, sunny environments.
